official_title: To limit the antitrust exemption applicable to joint agreements among certain professional sports teams regarding telecasting their games played at home for viewing without charge to the public.

summary.text: Fairness to Fans Act of 1991 - Provides that the antitrust exemption for television agreements of professional sports leagues shall not apply to a person (or league of which such person is a member) if the number of free televised regular season home games of a professional team controlled by such person is less than the average number of such games televised during the regular seasons over the ten-year period beginning in 1981.
